content:
The Dramatists Guild of America (DGA) does offer discounts and special programs for students and emerging playwrights.

**Student Membership:**

The DGA offers a discounted student membership rate of $35 per year for students currently enrolled in a degree-granting program. Student members receive access to many of the same benefits as full members, including script registration, feedback services, and online resources.

**Emerging Playwrights:**

The DGA has a few programs and resources specifically designed for emerging playwrights:

1. **Fellowships:** The DGA offers various fellowships, including the Dramatists Guild Fellowship, which provides a year of mentorship, support, and networking opportunities.
2. **Playwrights-in-Residence:** The DGA partners with theaters and organizations to offer Playwrights-in-Residence programs, providing emerging playwrights with opportunities to develop their work and gain industry experience.
3. **Discounted Membership:** Emerging playwrights can apply for a discounted membership rate of $50 per year, which includes access to many of the same benefits as full members.

**Script Registration Discounts:**

The DGA offers a discounted script registration rate of $10 for student members and emerging playwrights. This is a great way to get your script registered and protected while saving some money.

**Other Resources:**

The DGA also offers a range of free resources and tools for playwrights, including:

1. **The Dramatists Guild Resource Directory:** A comprehensive directory of industry resources, including theaters, agents, and production companies.
2. **The Business of Playwriting:** A series of online articles and guides covering the business side of playwriting, from copyright law to contracts and negotiations.
3. **Playwrights' Corner:** A section of the DGA website featuring articles, interviews, and advice from established playwrights and industry professionals.

I hope this helps! If you have any more questions or would like to learn more about the DGA's programs and resources, I encourage you to visit their website or contact them directly.
